abstract: The Dow climbed in the last hour of trading after giving up early gains spurred by the announcement of new government moves to ease the credit crisis. The Nasdaq and S&P were flat.
snippet: The Dow climbed in the last hour of trading after giving up early gains spurred by the announcement of new government moves to ease the credit crisis. The Nasdaq and S&P were flat.
lead_paragraph: On Tuesday, Wall Street completed a feat it has not accomplished in more than two months: it went three consecutive days without a loss.

headline.main: Wall Street Mixed After Credit Moves
headline.print_headline: A Market in Turmoil Ends Mostly Higher

byline.original: By Jack Healy and Michael M. Grynbaum

abstract: Sometimes, a crazy day in the market is not necessarily a bad thing, The New York Times’s Michael M. Grynbaum writes.
lead_paragraph: Sometimes, a crazy day in the market is not necessarily a bad thing, The New York Times’s Michael M. Grynbaum writes.

headline.main: Markets Surge for a Second Day; Dow Up Nearly 400
